Abandonment.definition: the act of abandoning property or a right

1.definition: the act of abandoning property or a right

sub_terms.a: relinquishment by an inventor of the right to enforce a patent see also
sub_terms.b: an author's relinquishment to the public domain of his or her copyrighted work
sub_terms.c: relinquishment of a trademark established by a failure to use the trademark and an intention never to resume use
sub_terms.d: the act of an insured in surrendering all rights to damaged or lost property to an insurer as a total loss compare
sub_terms.e: relinquishment by a trustee in bankruptcy of interest in property in the bankruptcy estate often for a nominal sum

2.definition: the act of abandoning a person

sub_terms.a: failure to have contact with a spouse that is intended to create a permanent separation
sub_terms.b: failure to communicate with or provide financial support for one's child over a period of time that shows a purpose to forgo parental duties and rights

3.definition: the act of abandoning a contract

4 a.definition: the act of abandoning a course of action (as a crime)

sub_terms.b: the affirmative defense (as recognized under the Model Penal Code) of voluntary withdrawal from the commission of a crime resulting from the actor's change of heart and not from intervening circumstances
